intro: Rhomboda tokioi, commonly known as the Tokyo rhombod, is a rare flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive rhombic-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
